UUIDs can never be null.  Therefore, it doesn't make sense to use null as a default.  Even if it did, we don't choose null as a default for anything unless the user selects it specifically by writing `"default": "null"`.

The default value you should use should be something like the all zeroes pattern.  You can create a single (public, static, final) instance of one of those in MessageUtil or somewhere, to avoid creating new ones each time we instantiate a Message class with UUIDs.
@cmccabe Maybe I missed the point; I thought this would set it to a "zero UUID" (previously, this was setting it to `null`).
